title: Ronna McDaniel
added: In June 2020, McDaniel shared a RNC video warning about extensive [[Electoral fraud|voter fraud]] in the upcoming 2020 election due to expansions of [[Postal voting in the United States|vote-by-mail]] related to the coronavirus pandemic.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |last=Rizzo |first=Salvador |date=June 24, 2020 |title=Fact-checking the GOP's 'satirical' vote-by-mail video |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/06/24/fact-checking-gops-satirical-vote-by-mail-video/ |access-date=August 3, 2020}}</ref> ''The Washington Post'' fact-checker wrote that the video "tortures the facts to create a narrative of an election about to be stolen. The illegality being satirized here is a phantom. State election officials, in many cases Republicans, are expanding vote-by-mail as a public health precaution to prevent the risk of spreading the coronavirus — not to rig the outcome."<ref name=":0" />

title: Ronna McDaniel
deleted: McDaniel is a Trump supporter<ref>[https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/05/ronna-mcdaniel-mitt-romney-trump-impeachment-110868 Forgey, Quint "Ronna McDaniel stands with Trump after uncle Mitt says he’ll vote to convict" ''Politico.com'', published February 5, 2020]</ref> that has stated her support with the president about the 2020 Election not being transparent. Her uncle, [[Mitt Romney]], voted to convict the president in his [[Impeachment of Donald Trump|impeachement]].

On November 9, she spoke at a press conference with Kayleigh McEnay. McDaniel said that that laws and rights to the poll watchers were denied and that the watcher didn't have control of what was going on. The press conference streamed live on YouTube and thousands of people watched. It also aired on Fox News, but the anchor stopped showing the audience, per his remarks: "Unless she has more details to back that up, I can't continue showing you this", said [[Neil Cavuto]]<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/media/2020/11/09/fox-news-kayleigh-mcenany-cut-away-fraud/ Izade, Elahe "Fox News cuts away from Kayleigh McEnany news conference after she alleges vote fraud with no evidence", WashingtonPost.com, published November 9, 2020]</ref>.

title: Ronna McDaniel
added: After Joe Biden won the 2020 election, McDaniel claimed without evidence that there was large-scale electoral fraud and voter fraud.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Oprysko|first=Caitlin|title=Ronna McDaniel asks for ‘time’ to produce specific claims of alleged voter fraud|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/06/ronna-mcdaniel-alleged-voter-fraud-434724|access-date=2020-11-18|website=POLITICO|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Gray|first=Kathleen|last2=Rutenberg|first2=Jim|last3=Corasaniti|first3=Nick|date=2020-11-18|title=Michigan Republicans Backtrack After Refusing to Certify Election Results|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/17/us/politics/michigan-certify-election-results.html|access-date=2020-11-18|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|date=2020-11-10|title=US election: Justice lawyer quits after attorney general orders 'vote fraud' inquiries|language=en-GB|work=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/election-us-2020-54882647|access-date=2020-11-18}}</ref> At the same time that she was making baseless claims of fraud, President Trump endorses her to continue to lead the RNC.<ref>{{Cite news|date=2020-11-11|title=Trump Wants McDaniel to Return as GOP Leader: Election Update|language=en|work=Bloomberg.com|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-11/recounts-unlikely-to-help-trump-overturn-loss-election-update|access-date=2020-11-18}}</ref>

title: Ronna McDaniel
deleted: On September 30, 2020, McDaniel tested positive for [[COVID-19]].<ref name="covid">{{Cite news |first1=Isaac |last1=Stanley-Becker |first2=Rosalind S. |last2=Helderman |first3=Josh |last3=Dawsey |first4=Amy |last4=Gardner |date=October 8, 2020 |title=Guests at Trump's events scattered across the country. Potentially exposed, many of their contacts may never be identified. |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/white-house-covid-contact-tracing/2020/10/08/f2583a74-08b6-11eb-a166-dc429b380d10_story.html |url-status=live |access-date=October 9, 2020 |archive-date=October 9, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201009021258/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/white-house-covid-contact-tracing/2020/10/08/f2583a74-08b6-11eb-a166-dc429b380d10_story.html }}</ref> She and the Republican National Committee only disclosed the diagnosis publicly two days later, on October 2.<ref name="covid" /> The RNC made no attempt to inform individuals who had appeared at an event with McDaniel days earlier.<ref name="covid" /> She had been staying at her home in Michigan since September 26 after one of her relatives tested positive.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Collins |first1=Kaitlan |last2=Stracqualursi |first2=Veronica |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2020/10/02/politics/ronna-mcdaniel-coronavirus/index.html |title=RNC chairwoman tests positive for coronavirus |accessdate=October 2, 2020 |work=CNN |date=October 2, 2020 |archive-date=October 2, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201002135112/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/10/02/politics/ronna-mcdaniel-coronavirus/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet |last=Bender |first=Michael C. |user=MichaelCBender |number=1312022856239394819  |date=October 2, 2020 |title=Ronna McDaniel has tested positive for coronavirus. She found out Wednesday and has been home since the previous Saturday, according to statement from Republican National Committee. |language=en |access-date=October 2, 2020}}</ref>
